author: Hayley Perkin
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  Horrendous unnecessary queues. Lack of staff. Terrible service. Can’t even rate 1 star. Inefficient. Came here after an 8 hour flight and I’m not in best of health. Queue time of well over an hour- no seating , no explanation, no one on the desks. Appalling service taking up quality tourist time.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'April 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: V Lee
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  The workers at JFK airport, especially those from screening, are especially rude. While it is understandable that there are a myriad of travelers that they are responsible for screening, it does not excuse their behavior toward those traveling, especially the elderly and handicapped. They have no common sense and empathy toward the people who need help when travelling. I feel for our senior citizens who had to deal with the yelling and belittling while being rudely handled by the TSA at the airport. We all have stresses at our jobs, but please don't handle our US citizens like they are criminals.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'April 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: L Johnson
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  This airport sure has a way of getting you in a bad mood. Many TSA and border agents are rude and untactful, and if they're not, it's just plain disorganization, but on my last trip, the immigration staff managed to be rude and insulting both flying out and back (in transit). The first time, my wife, who has two passports, was unsure as to which passport to use. I won't go into details, but it was in complete good faith, but still an immigration officer told her arrogantly that she was "playing with identities" and to me, when I tried to explain the reasons, he asked aggressively how much I knew about migration law. Then, on the way back, another officer, having learned that we live in the DR, absentmindedly said "and I thought this was a bad place", right out of thin air. My other encounters with this airport have been better, but not exactly great.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'April 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Sandy Barazesh
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  I live in the New York area and therefore have to frequent this truly dreadful airport. There is no terminal at JFK without its flaws. Departures at Terminal One is somewhat decent, but the arrivals there is by far the worst. Terminal Four is a disgusting mess, and the rest are all horrible as well. To start, the staff at JFK are some of the rudest people I have ever met in my life. Just walking through the terminal you get looks from them, when you ask for help they're condescending, they bark orders at you instead of using a basic human being's tone. The airport is also disgusting. The bathrooms are not clean, some of the seats in the terminal or at gates will be wet or sticky, it's truly disgusting. The airport is also very confusing, gates are not clearly marked, nor where to find them. There are very few boards throughout the terminal. All staff at restaurants or food concessions are rude, or mess up your order, or are clueless. Flights at JFK are frequently delayed, and planes take forever to get to the gate which I can't seem to find a reason as to why that would be the airline's fault. The wifi at the airport also doesn't work at all, and better yet they don't seem to get any kind of cell service there (I've jumped around carriers and have always had the same issue). The security at the airport is a whole other animal. These people assume every person in line is guilty and will not hesitate to yell at you. The people at customs as well love to harass. The lounges at JFK also seem to be lacking. All New York area airports are lacking, but JFK really seems to be the worst.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'January 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Julie Hunter
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  Disgusted how I and my family were treated going through passport control. Lady shouting orders at us then tutting at us as if we were idiots as I handed her all passports together. She kissed her lips saying, 'jeez you should know it’s one at a time' then proceeded to shout at us to move quicker down the line. Rudest person I have ever met, JFK. You need to do some customer service with your rude staff, I won’t be travelling to or from this airport ever again.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Sanyal
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | As a frequent user of this airport, I am surprised by the generally negative reviews it gets. I mostly use Terminal 8 - tenants include American Airlines and several One World members - and have found it to be modern, spacious, with lots of seating and bathrooms, along with shops and eateries, and clean and tidy too! My recent trip through terminal 8 was no exception. True, the TSA staff often do not exude charm but they keep the lines moving through the security machines. On departure, I used the Admirals lounge - it offers nice views of the taxiways through large windows and a good selection of hard and soft drinks. More attention needs to be given to keep the food areas tidy, but more importantly, ensure the food trays have food on them! I returned from Canada and with US immigration done at point of departure, arrival at and exit out of the airport could not be faster or easier. Reviews on this site suggest that the experience varies across terminals and thus broad generalization about JFK may overlook many positive aspects of the airport including its easy access by public transportation.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: G Baker
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | After a 15 hour flight from Doha (and with connections to CA) I was stunned by the disorganization, wait-time and general chaos while re-entering the US today (March 31, 2018). The signage was wrong or non-existent, US Citizens are thrown into the same “lines” as non-citizens and there are far too few Officials to establish a semblance of order. The “Passport & Immigrantion” touch screens are temperamental and require multiple attempts to advance in order to procure the coveted ‘receipt’. One beleaguered red-coated employee said this was the ‘new normal’ as staffing was insufficient. That is clearly part of the problem, but the whole ‘process’ is highly problematic. We waited well over an hour to pass through and nearly missed our connection — with many others waiting much longer. And as we all stood there like cattle, it was impossible to get WiFi. One helpful fellow recommended downloading the Mobile Passport App in the future - but this doesn’t help visitors who were as distressed and annoyed as those of us who are citizens.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: P Pearce
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | After an 11 hour flight we were subjected to incompetence, rudeness and automated equipment failure, both in the passport scanning equipment and the fingerprint scanning equipment during our entry to the USA interview. There is no distinction between US Citizens and foreigners who all are forced to stand and wait in the same lines. The red jacketed attendant stupidly replied to me that this was a better system, that the signs for USCitizens did not mean anything, and that no one was superior with this system. This insulted me for several reasons. 1) All foreign destinations have lines for citizens and another line for non-citizens. The citizens lines tend to move rapidly. 2) I am a Vietnam Vet, a US Citizen, a taxpayer and feel we should have priority entering our own country. As it was, we waited in line for 2 hours, and after the fingerprint scanner failed, the Officer simply got up from his desk, closed the door and walked off the floor. If this was a private business, he would have been fired.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: B Berry
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified | TSA rude and unhelpful. Barking orders as loudly as possible and all the time the same orders as though it was a meat processing plant. We were told we were TSA Approved and it was on our pass for boarding - we were told to tell the staff member which we did. It seemed to make them want to search for a problem even more. They ridiculed my plastic boots given to all passengers in Madrid to keep their feet or socks clean when they remove shoes, and they were so rude and told me it was not acceptable after I had cleared the machine - shoes removed because of big heals. There was zero in my tiny case other than clothes but they held it back and kept it for so long another passenger intervened and told them to give it to me, and they had just left it sitting behind the the x ray box and had not done anything with it after the screening there! They then proceeded to try to close it and were catching the clothes in the zipper which seemed to amuse the man doing it. We asked for it back to close ourselves, before something was torn. This is about the third trip through this airport and we will never return to the airports [or city]. The flight to Seattle from Virgin was delayed three times and the the third time it was then backtracked upon and we were told - by a soft human voice and no inter-com it was "going right now". By then many people had walked right away from the gate to fill the three hours projected wait from the last delay: somewhere other than the boring gate area. People crowded around frantic to get on, and there was only an elderly staff member half directing who was boarding in a quiet voice with no inter-com. It was a total gong show, unbelievable. No cabin staff around other than at the door, and suitcases being stuffed into bins overhead where half would literally not fit! Swap out most of the staff to Seatac for two weeks and show them some manners and common sense tactics. Maybe La Guardia is better?? NJ certainly is not! I am a well travelled 72 year old, and this airport is the worst of the worst. Pay staff properly and get some fresh faces, not control freaks!
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "would not return to this airport by choice"
author: Taylor McLane
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  The terminals are so poorly organized and so are all the queues and checkpoints. The staff in security and even in restaurants were either unhelpful, rude, uninterested, or spoke to people very poorly, as if we are to blame for how unorganized they are? I have read numerous other negative reviews now and would not return to this airport by choice ever again. I hope someone higher up decides to take more pride in this establishment because it’s embarassing how awful our and others’ experiences have been. I would never recommend this airport to anyone.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: F Martin
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  JFK is the worst airport to have to get your bags at. Whenever I travel in Europe or another state you get off the plane and your bags arrive shortly after. At JFK you always have to wait forever and for no good reason. There is no consideration for passengers especially late at night. They should be embarrassed with their poor service everytime!
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Steve Greenaway
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | For an airport that has been established for so long, I could not believe at how disorganised it all was. You guys need to learn a few manners, try fellow Americans at Walt Disney world, they'd teach you a thing or two. Security staff were by far the worst here, very unprofessional, rude and unhelpful. Good luck to whoever is in charge of this disorganised team, you're definitely going to need it. You need to have a star rating for security/immigration, if there was, I'd struggle to award any star rating.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 5, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: John Mcnamara
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  Well after an eleven hour flight and not feeling too well - I was hoping for a speedy transit through customs (I was travelling with hand luggage only). Once I got into the customs hall reality hit - 1.5 hours waiting in line with hundreds maybe even thousands of other passengers to get processed. Heres the thing - they have 60 desks - 3 of which were manned. The whole feeling there was one of absoloute disdain for the passengers experience. Avoid this airport - find another route unless you like standing bored senseless as a first taste of America.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Landic
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I won't be going near this airport ever again, I have never ever experienced such poor treatment,  rudeness, laziness and gruesome attitude of staff that obviously think they are superior to all of us passengers. I hardly managed to catch my flight because of long queues, and because instead of following the signs and going into separate lines, all of us had to go in one line. Machines are not working properly, there is no one to show you what to do, and when you finally fight your way through crazed passengers and arrive to the officer in charge who will check your passport, you get a terrible treatment. Unfortunately, no one will care about all these negative reviews and about all our frustrations, until we all stop flying to and via NYC. Considering the number of people in the world, this will never happen, but I sincerely hope that someone will make a big deal out of it, someone important who will be treated like this and put a stop to all incompetent and miserable people who work there. Such an amazing city, but when you arrive it makes you never want to visit it again. Not even in transit.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Evans
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Horrific experience. I am not sure why, but the staff here think they are far superior to any passenger! We were treated terribly on arrival to the airport, with staff either ignoring us when we asked questions about which ESTA lane to join or they simply shouted their robotic “all first time ESTAs this way” in our faces. Both of us had been to the USA previously, so we joined the “returning ESTA” line, but apparently if you haven’t been within the last 2 years you have to join the “first time ESTA” line? Had the rude staff member we approached explained this it would have been quite simple. Then on departure the man at security was simply inhuman. Screeming at people to step inside a security screen and then barking orders like “don’t you dare move a muscle”, “are you blind?”. I understand the need for strict security with all that has happened in recent years, and I can appreciate the need for staff to be formal and professional, but that is not what this was. There was a complete disregard for maintaining the respect and dignity of passengers. There is absolutely no need to speak to people in such a manner, these people need to be taught some manners and get off their high horses. I won’t be flying into America again for this reason. I’d rather explore all of the other wonderful places in the world that treat other people with dignity and respect. The cleanliness of the airport was also an issue. With smelly toilets that were consistently out of loo paper and sticky seats and tables.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'March 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Dawn Chessell
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified | It was my 3rd visit to JFK and my daughters 1st. Each visit the process of going through immigration and security gets worse. On arrival from Heathrow it was clear to some of the staff at JFK that a few of us weren't sure where we had to go. When we approached staff we were either ignored, tutted at or laughed at. One member of staff was sniggering at a family struggling to use the self check in machines. It was chaotic. However at the end of our trip when we returned to JFK well what can I say. TSA service was disgusting. The only thing missing was a cattle prod. Shouting orders, humiliating people, talking to us like we were animals. I have never in my life experienced another human being talking to any member of the public like this. There was no need for it. Many people were visibly upset and uncomfortable. It upset myself and my daughter. I will never ever return to America again. It has totally put me off forever. I would also recommend friends and family to avoid JFK at all costs. That is unless they want to be treated like a prisoner. It was so nice to get home to Britain.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'February 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Richards
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  After entering the airport, everything was going well until we came across the TSA checkpoint. This is the first tsa checkpoint I have encountered with the most rude and unprofessional personnel in my thirty years of traveling around the world. The superiors of the tsa personnel need to go under cover and see for themselves what a nightmare JFK airport really is. The tsa employees were inconsiderate, rude, and words cannot describe their unprofessionalism. Not only was my family affected by their actions, but everyone in the same line. Never ever go to this airport, until they clean up the tsa's act! Other than the tsa, everything was fine.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'February 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: T Andrews
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | My boyfriend and I were travelling to Cancun from Heathrow via New York JFK. The booking allowed for 3.5 hours between flights which we assumed would be sufficient. In fairness to the airport there had been heavy snow the day before but when we arrived and went to baggage reclaim, it took 2 hours for the bags to come through, my bag came through on a different carousel! It was sheer luck I overheard another passenger telling someone that I found my bag at all. We deposited them with the Baggage Transfer Desk and ran to catch our flight which was, fortunately for us, delayed anyway. The staff there were surly, unhelpful and rude, no appreciation of our dilemma at all. We arrived at Cancun to find out our baggage had not arrived and in fact it took 3 days to turn up, we were very stressed and ended up having to go shopping for clothes and other items which we could barely fit in our luggage. On our return, everything ran very smoothly, arrived in time, quickly retrieved our luggage, passed it to Baggage Transfer and got on our flight without any problems back to Heathrow. Unbelievably only one of our bags turned up, we are still waiting for the other one which was delayed for reasons unknown in JFK. I will never ever go via this airport again, I will either find another route or not bother than go through this misery. If it wasn't for my boyfriend's and I determination to make the best of a bad situation, it would have totally destroyed out first long distance holiday together. Avoid this airport at all costs.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'January 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Karim Rogers
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | This airport is really poor in handling the air traffic let alone the ground traffic. I arrived from Cairo and left a 3.5 hour transit time. The immigration queues are massive and once you pass immigration you have go to baggage claim. You need to buy a trolley for $6, god help you if you manage to find one, let alone if you don't have dollars. Unfortunately the airport staff are not helpful and aggressive and make you feel you are not to approach or bother them. In transit you need to claim baggage first if you arrival in terminal 4, its chaotic getting out and trying to find your terminal departure or connecting flight - very crowded. I would honestly try to plan to avoid arriving in JFK. The departure hall in terminal 4 is really nice with a lot of amenities and services, if you have the luxury of time, however even with a 3.5 hour transit time I thought that was enough, I was wrong.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'January 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "No excuse for an airport of this magnitude"
author: Carolyn Madry
reviewBody:
❎ Not Verified |  
It was a horrible experience! First we kept getting delayed because of the plane leaving JFK to get to us. 5 hour delay which cost us an extra $150 in lunch and drinks at the airport for four of us. We finally board, and land at JFK only to be told we don't have a gate! Sat there for almost 3 hours, pull up to a gate and no one to direct the pilot all the way in. 15 min wait for that! So glad that we didn't have bags checked in! I'm now sick because of being up for 24 hours. My youngest son had to drive back to college that same day. Should have been home by 9.30 Saturday night instead of 5.30 am Sunday. Felt bad for the flight crew, they were completely spent from being on the previous flight also. No excuse for an airport of this magnitude!
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'January 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Maggie Elizabeth
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  Never in my life, as an adult or child, have I ever experienced being spoken to in the way I was at JFK airport. Every member of staff I came into contact with was disinterested in their tasks, rude, careless and irritated. At customs I was shouted at by members of staff and when making a mistake with which way to line up I was humiliated by staff who laughed at me and questioned me in the most patronising way about why I had gone one way and not another. Once through customs I burst into tears after such an unnecessary and upsetting ordeal. The staff at JFK are absolutely the rudest people I have ever met. I cannot understand why they are allowed to behave like that. I will avoid this airport at all costs in future and will be reluctant to visit NYC. Disgraceful. Manners are free, a smile is easier than a frown and belittling others is not an acceptable form of ‘crowd control’. Playground bullies.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'January 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: C Dawson
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Landed at New York JFK late from the Dominican Republic. JFK airport knew of our late arrival 4 hours in advance. We landed at 11.50 pm and we are still waiting on the plane, which is now 2.00 am and no word about them getting us off anytime soon. Just been sitting here for the last two hours! I hate JFK airport, they are so unorganized!
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "JFK airport you have to pull it together"
author: D Walker
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Returned from London to New York, after an 8 hour flight we had to stay inside the airplane for 4 more hours since JFK had no place for us to unboard, terrible situation for any traveler. When we finally unboarded at 3.30 am the airplane, we went to immigration where we encountered a severely overcrowded area with passengers and under staffed by immigration officers trying to cope, that took us about 2 hours more. JFK airport you have to pull it together, very disorganized and unfriendly place to be.

header: "not a great start to a holiday"
author: Sarah Taylor
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  A horrible experience, disorganised, rude staff and not a great start to a holiday. Customs people were rude and sorry, job or not, manners are a must for anyone. Sorry USA but you don’t offer great customer service.

author: R Andrews
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | After having a lovely week visiting New York our last experience left a bitter taste in our mouths. The staff at the departure gates, (flight no EI0108, December 6 at 21.10) were downright rude! I can’t understand why these people work with the public, they have no people skills whatsoever. They were very obviously never taught any manners or customer service skills and they must have no one supervising them.The way they spoke at (yes spoke at, not to) people queuing up made my blood boil and I could see a number of people extremely annoyed by their behaviour. Would not recommend this airport to anyone and will be avoiding in the future.

author: T Pearson
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Arrived from Barcelona on T4. If you have kids and need a luggage cart after customs, they charge you $6 for the short trip out the doors. You also have to walk out of the secure area if you just connect. TSA does not care if you have kids with stroller. Narrow waiting lines do not make it easy either.

author: Anthony Wright
reviewBody: ❎ Not Verified |  I had to date this as happening in December 2016 but the actual date was September 2016. On arrival I was in a wheelchair and was shouted at because it seemed the hand scanner was not successful in scanning my hand, after 3 attempts he shouted, 'What have you got on your hands'. What can you say. I didn't know why it didn't work. He tried again, still nothing. So then he starts shouting at me to go to a different scanner. It appeared it was all my fault that it didn't work. The second scanner was successful on the second attempt. It was all done in a horrible uncaring manner and I have to say I was beginning to regret traveling to New York at all. The immigration official was so miserable and rude I felt I was totally not welcome in the country. When leaving New York it was even worse. I was in a wheelchair again and was shouted at to go this way and that way. I then underwent an intensive search in public. The wheelchair was scanned and that belonged to the airport. When he was finished I was told that I was sitting in the wheelchair with my legs apart and that looked suspicious. I suppose that and the fact that my body was shaking because I have Parkinson's made me a potential criminal at 73 years old. I wouldn't have minded so much if they didn't talk to me as if I was already guilty commiting a crime. They are rude, unsympathetic and downright nasty without cause and I will not be going back there again.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'December 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Cynthia Raymond
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  The airport security was absolutely horrible. There is nobody giving directions on getting through security check. Most airports have you take off your shoes, place coats on belt, etc. Not JFK. They make their own rules. They don’t tell people what to do, they scream. I understand NY has tight security, but there’s no reason to scream violently at passengers trying to catch their flights. Absolutely worst experience ever. From now on I’ll be avoiding JFK at all costs.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'November 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: John Smith
reviewBody: ❎ Unverified |  When booking my travel, I go out of my way to avoid JFK airport. Besides the expected hour long wait on the runway before take off, that every flight experiences, the terminal is a nightmare. TSA employees are always very unprofessional. The person who takes your ticket at a movie theater behaves better than these people. The employees at the resturausnts would rather you "go over there" for food, instead of you sitting at their restaurant. Food is terrible, atmosphere is terrible, people are miserable, WiFi never works right. Next time I fly to DC, I am absolutely going to fly through either ATL or DET. The longer flights from Boston is much much better than dealing with the the headaches that come with JFK.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'November 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: D Pearce
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Awful, awful terminal. Noisy, small, crowded. Nowhere decent to eat, very little choice. Small convenience stores, long queues. Totally inadequate charging facilities for devices - 10 to each gate in a block, not at seats. Poor WiFi, only 30 minutes free. None of the escalators were working. Lift slow and small, could barely cope with one trolley. Poor shopping. No computer or camera outlets. Just awful, expected JDK to world class but I will go a long way to avoid flying there again.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'November 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "an embarrassment for such a major city"
author: Howard Frey
reviewBody: ❎ Unverified |  JFK is the absolute worst airport in the world and I have been in most of them as I travel globally often. It is dirty, and very third world - it is an embarrassment for such a major city. All the airport staff are horrible and incredibly rude. I usually fly out of JFK for the convenience but it’s not worth it, better not by much, to go to Newark. As an American and a New Yorker it is a disgrace. you get what you pay for JFK.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'November 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Kevin Hughes
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Terminal 7 is shocking to say the least. A complete lack of seating is available which is not helpful at all when travelling with elderly relatives. There were no customer assistants or staff to direct or help. The air con was broken or does not exist but the temperature was far too hot and unacceptable. The wandering tiki was over run with people due to lack of seating in the terminal or at the gates. Just trying to get a drink was an ordeal in itself. The staff however were friendly but evidently unable to keep up with demand. The long island brew house was put of action however even with this I do not feel this would have helped the seating situation. People were literally laying all over the floor. I can guarantee I will be paying extra to fly in and out of Newark.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'November 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: D Kemp
reviewBody: ❎ Unverified |  Worst airport ever. As an American, I feel ashamed that there are people from other nationalities coming and going from this airport daily and experiencing the downright dehumanizing rudeness from its employees. Despite just getting off an 11 hour flight and a three hour one before that, I was in a good mood, until I arrived here. The immigration line was long and horrible when arriving. The place is filthy and the food selections are downright terrible. When I checked my luggage in, the clerk was extremely rude straight away and acted bothered by nothing. TSA both coming and going were unprofessional with horrible attitudes whose only real profession seemed to be making snide comments for extremely petty reasons. Everywhere I went there were long lines of people being herded along like cattle by some rude staff member. I have to wonder, is it in these people's job descriptions to be blatantly rude? I will do what I need to never use this airport again, even if that means paying more for a ticket elsewhere.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Dawn Milner
reviewBody: ❎ Unverified |  This has to be the worst airport ever. The staff were vile and aggressive. Myself and my daughter were shouted at for walking to the wrong line, a line that another employee had told us to join. This is what she shouted verbatim - 'Hello maam, Hello am I not here? Are you blind? Are you just going to ignore my instruction?' To which I replied of course not, it was obvious that she wasn't interested in what her colleague has said. This was a bully who was on a power trip. We stood in line and watched as she continued to belittle others, absolutely disgusting behaviour.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Matthew Aujard
reviewBody: ❎ Unverified |  Unnecessarily rude, airport is unorganised, shops are overpriced and nowhere to sit. I hope I never have to fly to this airport again. The only good thing about the airport was the air train which was pretty efficient but, apart from that my experience was terrible.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Robinson
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Quite double experience with JFK airport. T4 is ok, but nothing outstanding. The CBP clearance during arrival was very chaotic. Officers/personnel pointing you in the wrong direction. The baggage was taken from the belt and put together on the ground due to a lack of sufficient amounts of reclaim belts. Departure was smooth. No long waiting times in the DL Priority area, curbside very crowded. TSA not that bad, only 10 mins or so. But the waiting areas around the gates were very crowded. I was happy that I was able to acces the DL Skyclub to avoid all those people and crying children. Duty-free very overpriced and limited shopping.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'July 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: K Morton
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  TSA staff at Terminal 7 were extremely rude, perhaps the worst I've ever encountered. They literally bark at you, offering no assistance if you look like you're struggling. My husband forgot his wedding ring after leaving security, when he went back to get it the TSA officer was disgustingly rude. My husband is not one to back down so he gave him a piece of his mind. Nevertheless, it was a horrible experience. You can be firm and polite, there is absolutely no excuse for such rudeness.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'September 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "an extremely long walk to US Customs"
author: Spencer Neuman
reviewBody: ❎ Unverified |  When I arrived in New York's JFK Airport, it was an extremely long walk to US Customs. Once I arrived at customs there were two very long lines. Since I was a US citizen, I was able to get on the shorter line. I had to use electronic kiosks and then was redirected to a long line. But luckily, there were plenty Customs Officers on duty so I was able to get through in about 20 minutes. Baggage claim wasn't too bad and taxi dispatch got me a taxi really quickly.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'September 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Anjollie Feradov
reviewBody: ❎ Unverified | Horrible System! Arrived at 11am didn't get out until 12:49 pm. 2 hours. Very inefficient system of scattered scanners, people having difficulty and staff refusing to help people. Then you wait in a disorganized line for customs control. Asked me if I brought anything and I replied that I didn't bring food whereby he rudely lashed out "that's not what I asked you". This is no way to be welcomed back to the United States regardless of being citizen or not. We are supposed to be a leader in technology and friendly country yet first impressions by every face I saw was one of misery, fear of complaining and disappointment. Luggage area has videos playing yet no info on which flight suitcases are coming from. Very disappointing.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'August 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: C Choi
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  I arrived at JFK for the first time in four years in June 2017. The immigration checkpoint had changed by then, with everyone required to scan his/her passport at a computer kiosk. Fortunately, an airport employee was nice enough to show me where to stand to take my picture. The Homeland Security official who checked my passport and customs declaration form (6059B) didn't stamp it. After retrieving my luggage and queuing up to submit the 6059B, an armed customs officer brusquely asked me why I'd gotten in line. I told him that I was waiting to submit the form and he rhetorically asked if he'd told me to get in line. So I left the queue and exited the terminal. Thankfully, that was the only bad treatment I got at JFK during this trip. Two months later, when I departed New York, security at its Terminal 1 was surprisingly streamlined. TSA didn't require passengers to take off their shoes, produce their laptops, or receive a body scan/patdown. I must have entered another dimension.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'August 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: B Anderson
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  I used to like Terminal One at JFK. No so, this time. The TSA agents were beyond rude. They were shouting (barking) orders at the people on the line as if they were drill sergeants. If someone left something in his or her pocket they insulted him and yelled that he's holding up the line. When someone is screaming at you at the top of his lungs, it's hard to comprehend and follow his instructions. I have been to airports all over the world and do occasionally make a mistake. I have found that everywhere else, the agents are polite and usually friendly. These people need serious retraining and should be let go if they can't behave like humans.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'August 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "I was in a good mood before I got to this place"
author: L Lewis
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Rudest staff I have ever encountered at an airport or any place of business for that matter. I don't fly often so I was not familiar with the kiosk check in. It asked for my confirmation number, I did not know where to find it on my voucher (it was called something different on the voucher) so I asked a floor staff member for help. I asked how to use the kiosk and she replied, "what's hard about it? Do you know how to read? All you have to do is read!" Her tone was demeaning and she kept walking as she was speaking to me. TSA agents were basically rude robots getting easily frustrated over nothing. Even the lady working at the small convenience store near gate #32 was extremely rude when a price was not clear on an item. I was in a good mood before I got to this place.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'July 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Watkins
reviewBody: ❎ Unverified |  The passport control employees at immigration control are beyond horrible and rude. Most of them around the entry queues can barely speak English. They all have very bad attitudes and will offer no help. If you go through there, be sure to take your blood pressure medication beforehand.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'July 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Andrew Scott
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review | Horrible staff, who are not willing to help anyone and speak very rudely. My flight was delayed 3 hours, and not once was anyone in the slightest bit apologetic, and when I asked how much longer it would be and politely mentioned I had been traveling for 22 hours and was deeply tired they said to me 'oh well that's not our fault is it'. Only nice person I spoke to at JFK was the man at customs when I arrived.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'July 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: K Parker
reviewBody: ❎ Unverified |  I've never experienced an airport with ruder staff, from the staff scanning to the customs staff to the McDonalds staff. Not a smile, not a conversation. It was my partner and I's first time in America and there was no help at all to make the situation any easier.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'June 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Sanyal
reviewBody: ❎ Unverified |  I used Terminal 1 for our recent trip. On the outbound journey, the security check lines were long but moved rapidly. The terminal is used by a large number of airlines. It has a good collection of shops and restaurants. The Alitalia lounge was spacious and airy with a good selection of self servings of finger food and drinks including beer from Italy. It also offered free wifi and an announcement was made when our flight was ready to board. On return, we used the automatic kiosks for our passports. The exit was a breeze. The officers were pleasant and we were out of the terminal in no time. In sum, it was a hitch free experience considering the number of passengers and flights that as handled by this terminal.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'June 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

header: "the rudest agents I have ever encountered"
author: C Ball
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  The TSA agents at JFK are the rudest agents I have ever encountered. Several of them were shamelessly shouting at passengers undergoing security screening. Others simply didn't deign to speak to passengers. My partner was retrieving his things after they had been scanned, and he was apparently in one officer's way. Instead of saying "excuse me" like a decent person, she stood directly behind him until he noticed her, and then she made the "shoo" hand gesture at him. From one adult to another! It's honestly appalling. Additionally, Terminal 7 doesn't have enough seating, and I have located exactly six outlets (that work - I found two others that did not work) in the Gates 1-6 section. And I don't mean six pairs, I mean three pairs.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'June 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Paul Maxwell Dumfries
reviewBody: Organisation AT New York JFK is unbelievably poor. Queue times are ridiculous for people coming over on holiday. 1 hour 15 minites in a queue before being seen by customs and yet there are 60 customs booths but no movement. Customer service is poor. It will be the last time I ever use this airport. Highly recommend Newark. Worst Airport ever. Frustration is at maximum when I'm supposed to be on holiday.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'June 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: C Jordan
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review | It took two hours from arrival at the gate at New York JFK Airport to pick up my luggage. Incredibly slow immigration process once again. It rivals the arrivals process at MIA. Passengers with connecting flights should be warned to allow at least three hours between flights, not the two hours or even less posted by the airlines. An incredibly stressful process.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'May 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

header: "not a great start to our stay"
author: Alasdair Herkes
reviewBody: After being on the go for over 12 hours travelling from Iceland on a 5.5 hour flight and being very tired and hungry we finally arrived at JFK to be met with massive queues to get through passport control. Security is fine with me as safety in a top priority but JFK was ridiculous. We had to wait inline for over 1.5 hours! My legs were killing me, out of 28 or 29 desks only 3 were open which is a total joke. I was so dehydrated and was not offered water until we were next in line to be seen, the heat was unbearable and it took ages for them to offer to take anyone with small children to the front which I feel should of been done straight away. It was around 9PM, when we were finally seen and our paper work was barley checked. It took a matter of minutes for us to be on out way, not a great start to our stay in the USA
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'May 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: T Clulow
reviewBody: Terrible immigration queues. Electronic passport readers largely rejected all passengers. Of 40 available desks, only one was manned and he dissapeared after 10 minutes. Excuse: change of shift and new shift hasn't arrived yet. Queued for 90 minutes (yes nine zero) by which time there was a total of three manned desks. Queue now weaved in and out of all the electronic readers accross the hall and back up the ramp from the planes.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'April 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Angela Tolliver
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Got to international entry from France and picked up our luggage to go through customs, the carts were there and the cost was $6. Less than 50 feet later, we were told we couldn't take the cart in. That is absolutely wrong! There was no sign saying that you couldn't take it. The airport was so hot, the hike to the gate was ridiculously long without the cart. After an overseas flight, it is ridiculous to not provide some kind of cart to go to the gate.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'April 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: C Jenkins
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Shocking customer service. The terminal transfer train comes every 15 to 20 minutes! I sat and watched as the cleaner moved 3 customers who were in the middle of their meals so he could rearrange the tables. I then tried to get a coffee in the only coffee shop open in the entire terminal (it's 9.47 pm) only to be told they wouldn't serve me because they are closing, in 15 minutes. So far, that attitude of every staff member has been that they simply couldn't care less. The management needs some serious addressing to have allowed the staff to get away with such poor performance.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'April 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: David Crowder
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  On arriving into New York JFK we headed for the nightmare of passing through immigration. We joined the conga line in about 300th place and the queue did not move for ages. Looking around I could see 2 officers in booths. This is ridiculous, by now the line had extended to crazy proportions and there must have been 1500 people some with very young children crying through tiredness and hunger. We were given no reason for this delay and were not given any water at all. It took us nearly 4hrs from plane to leaving. I think this needs looking at very seriously. I suffer from diabetes and this made me feel dreadful through lack of food and water and ruined my first day in a wonderful country.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: F Marsh
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  I have used this airport many times, where I have generally not had a bad experience. But after my recent trip to New York, passing through JFK, I am left feeling saddened by my observation that something has gone very wrong with this airports ability to provide a decent level of customer service. My arrival process involved myself and other customers being left standing in a line, not moving, for a considerable length of time, looking at empty immigration desks. Also the self service pass port check machines were not available. No explanation or apology was made for a very obvious problem. Some public announcement was made, worded in a way that only airport staff could understand, immigration officers made their way to their desks, we were then processed reasonably quickly. It was during my departure when I experienced similar issues already explained in other bad reviews for this airport, regarding security staff. I am left disgusted by the total lack of professionalism and any kind of courtesy or respect from your staff during the security process. I shared my concern with a member of staff at the Information Desk (with the understanding that it was not within her jurisdiction) who's response made it clear to me that she felt I was overreacting. I am left feeling that the management of JFK Airport have no understanding or just don't care that their airport staff are giving their customers such a vile experience. I don't feel comfortable to give JFK Airport my custom again.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'March 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Seating': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Sanyal
reviewBody: The different terminals of this sprawling airport offer different experiences. Terminal 8 is used by Cathay Pacific. The flight arrives in the afternoon. It was a smooth experience. I used the automated kiosk to complete the immigration formalities - no need to fill out a paper form and look for a pen. There were many such kiosks and hence waiting time to find one available was very minimal. I presented the print out from the kiosk to the immigration officer, who stamped my passport and the print out, and was waved into the luggage retrieval hall. Not having any checked luggage, I exited into the terminal after handing over the print out to the customs agent. Took the elevator upstairs and walked five minutes to the airport train that connects to the City's public transport system - very convenient with fares paid at the exit station. From getting out of the plane to getting out of the terminal it took 15 minutes - no hassle whatsoever. Signs were clear and prominent throughout.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 5, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: T Vickers
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  I have traveled the world and JFK is the winner for lack of signage, lack of people that help or know anything about the airport they work in. I am a seasoned traveler arrived at terminal 2 to go to terminal 4. No signs, no info, no help for luggage. I had to go outside, cross the road find the air train to get to terminal 4. Then the tea agent toget into security area to renovate was rude and when I asked a question was even more rude. I have never had this treatment anywhere but JFK. The lines for security are very long, I couldn't find the end of the line because they appear to be clumped together. Needless to say avoid at all costs. This place is an embarrassment
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: M Jones
reviewBody: This was my first time to the JFK airport and may be my last. We arrived with a 4 hour layover and thank goodness we did because we needed all that time to get through everything. First of, customs. What a nightmare. We stood in a line for an hour and forty minutes just to speak to the officer. Other families had screaming children, elderly people, and people needing to catch an immediate connecting flight. The computer system went down for about 35 minutes and nobody bothered to inform anyone what was going on. We then had to go speak to the agriculture department because we accidentally forgot that my husband had a couple of oranges in his bag and when we tried to declare them they didn't even give us the time of day. We then had to get to our departing terminal which was about 15 minutes away which we never would have made it to if we didn't follow someone who was also making the same connecting flights, ie there were no signs to point us where to go. I was frustrated and upset and during our 4 hour layover we were actually only waiting at our gate for about 25 minutes before boarding started because of all the hoops we had to go through to get there. Absolutely ridiculous.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'March 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Tang
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  I had a 6:25am flight but misjudged the travel time on the train as I forgot all the trains run local overnight. I arrive shortly before 6am and see a long security line so I realize I am unlikely to make my flight. It's my fault so I realize I have to accept my fate. But once they scanned my ticket, a TSA worker asks who is boarding the flight. I raise my hand and they make sure I get through the security line and tell me to run towards the gate. I run to the gate with my bag and the airline staff usher me on board, as I'm the last to arrive before the doors close. I am so thankful I made my flight! JFK gets some poor reviews and I've had less than stellar experiences there but this one restores my faith in JFK staff. They have to put up with a lot and I really appreciated them helping me make my flight.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'February 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 5, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Airport Staff': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: F Amy
reviewBody: On departure, we found a very limited choice of eating places at New York JFK. Seating was tight at the gate. On return, our group of 37 mostly senior citizens were stranded overnight at the airport because of weather-related cancellations. Staff who handled the rebooking were friendly and helpful, but when it became apparent that we were all spending the night at the airport, we were not assisted at all. The check-in section of the airport had very limited seating, and what few seats were available were already occupied or we were not allowed to use (not sure why). We ended up trying to sleep on the hard floor. We ended up flying out from LaGuardia and were much more impressed with the facility and staff there.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'March 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "Giving this airport a 1 is being kind"
author: M Johnson
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Is 0 an option? Giving this airport a 1 is being kind. Every time I go through it is delayed getting to the gate or taking off. This is not due to the airlines but the airport not managing traffic. Getting from one terminal to another is a joke and I have missed flights waiting on the Busses to move. Avoid this airport at all cost.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'February 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: F Clarkson
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review | New York JFK is probably the worst airport I have ever been to and I have been to many. Staff are horrible. There is no real method to lining up to go through security it just seems like a mess. They keep telling you not to block the areas but there is nowhere for people to go. Immigration is a shambles, the machines are good but again there is no real methodology to lining up. It says go to a machine when the lights are green but there are about 100 machines, half of which you can't see from the line. I was at gate C68 and assumed I had plenty of time when I followed the signs but no, without warning it told me I had to take a shuttle bus to another terminal. Why not say that like other airports e.g. time from here to gate -- then people know where they are and how much time they have - simple. Luckily though I did have enough time due to the airports sheer incompetence. As I write this I am still sitting on the plane after 2.5 hours waiting to be de-iced. I mean who would ever think that it snows in New York in January? If only we could forecast these things and maybe get more than one hairdryer to de-ice 125 planes! I am just passing through from a civilized airport, Heathrow, I am going to avoid this airport in future even if it costs more.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'January 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "the worst airport we've ever been to"
author: Vanessa Davies
reviewBody: Probably the worst airport we've ever been to, security is shocking, no trays used when going through security so items get mixed up and once through, staff are rude and most unhelpful. Don't try to buy duty free because we tried to buy one bottle of whiskey 1 hour before take off and were rudely refused at one duty free and told to go to the one close to our gate. We got there and were told "it's too late we can't sell", absolutely no reasoning and can only think it was because we only wanted one bottle. If we return to New York it will definitely not be via this airport, luckily the city is so good they named it twice and gave them two airports, one with nice helpful staff and the other with rude staff.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'January 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Rory Mcleod
reviewBody: Terminal 7 - the worst experience I've had in an airport including in third world countries. It is built for one quarter of the amount of people, security takes forever, you cannot sit anywhere as there are about 5 seats and you are really made to feel like cattle. Horrible experience, avoid at all costs.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'December 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Joy Jones
reviewBody: Arrival was dreadful. Long queues and only a small fraction of the desks staffed. Anticipated wait times displayed on screens changed erratically and were wildly optimistic. There were several people apparently organising queues when they would have been better deployed staffing some of the unoccupied desks. In contrast, departure was fine.

author: D Cate
reviewBody: There is no smoking lounge. I don't know maybe the people who decided to close the smoking lounges weren't smokers and don't understand the amount of stress a smoker goes through. I just landed here after a three hour flight and now I'm getting my connection which is 9 hours, I want a smoke. And the fact that JFK is smoke free annoys me. I hate going through this airport.

author: Pandel Cristian
reviewBody: Until now I had not used an airport like New York JFK. It's s like movie from 60s. Very bad service, no air, small. The best advice don't use the dirty toilets in terminal 7. Please avoid British Airways and terminal 7 from JFK. Dirty everywhere - even in the childrens' playroom.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'December 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: E Morse
reviewBody: After going through Heathrow the experience at JFK couldn't have been more worse. I stupidly assumed JFK (given it is the gateway to NYC) would be at least as good as Heathrow, how wrong this was. The arrivals is a totally disorganised shambles staffed by people with zero customer service skills, the arrivals area itself needs knocking down and rebuilding to make it fit for purpose. The airport doesn't have any proper (train) links into NYC so you are at the least an hour in a taxi or bus. The departures is just as bad as the security check is again disorganised and the staff again seem to have been employed for their lack of ability to deliver any sort of courtesy. The assumption was the departures area would be somewhere to relax etc, however again this was mis founded as the departures area must have been last refurbished when Concorde was still flying, it is tiny, miserable and a relief to get out from. The prices for the food are extortionate and there are very few toilets for the volume of people. In summary JFK is extremely disappointing and stands as an embarrassment to the city of New York, the Management should take a trip to Heathrow T5 and try and replicate some best practice.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'December 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "a very difficult airport to get around"
author: E Mekker
reviewBody: JFK is a very difficult airport to get around when flying international. First of all, we had to get on a bus that took us to terminal 2, then exit the terminal to go to terminal 1. There were no signs that told you where to exit to go to terminal 1. This was very frustrating as we had to ask a number of people where to go. Then once you got to terminal 1, you need to go upstairs to the departures. When you have a layover of 1.5 hours, that is a very short time considering that you still have to go through security again. Once we finally got through security in terminal 1, our flight was already boarding. Because of this inconvenience, I will do everything possible to never fly through JFK again. However, on one of my previous international flights, JFK did offer a red ticket to assist me with getting through security faster because my layover was very short. While that is an improvement, having to leave the airport and then go through security again, especially when I have purchased water for my flight and then have to drink it or throw it away was very inconvenient.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'November 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: John McArthur
reviewBody: New York JFK terminal 7 arrivals. What a shambles. I've been to this airport a dozen times over a few years and the experience just gets worse. The huge arrival queue in the low ceiling corridor is the most grim way anyone could enter a country and after an hour or more you reach the new custom controls. New feature is you scan your own passport and prints and this is I suppose to speed things up and save money. Problem is there are maybe 15 booths and hundreds of arrivals. It takes ages and it is not simple to complete all the steps. Surely a famous airport like JFK can just do far better? Awful and continues to be awful.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'November 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Bethany Caddick
reviewBody: Upon arrival at JFK things went smoothly, the queue for customs wasn't too long and we were in and out quite quick. Our longest wait was for transfers to our hotel. However departure was a completely different experience. Due to traffic we arrived at the airport with 2.5 hours before our plane departed. We thought this was more than enough time. As we had checked in online, we went straight to the bag drop printed our tickets and labels and dropped off the bags, easy enough. However the problems started in security. The queue was huge and ther seemed to be absolutely no organisation what's so ever. Our passports were checked and we were told to queue for our bags to be checked. Me and my partner went through but my mum was held behind. I asked the tsa worker if she'd let her through as she's a nervous flyer and I didn't want to leave her behind panicking. They kindly did so. The queue for bag drop was so disorganised there was no real line, it would stop moving and no bags were scanned for 10 minutes and ther me are very few body scanners considering the size of the airport. Each security worker had different instructions on what to do with shoes, jackets, tablets etc which was causing further delay when someone else nearer to the scanner told you it was incorrect. We eventually got through security with 5 minutes to spare, and then had to wait a further hour for the flight to depart as so many people had been in a similar situation. The airport is an absolute shambles and I would never fly from this airport again, or recommend it to friends or family
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: C Djaelani
reviewBody: New York JFK is without doubt the least professional, least organised and rudest airport I have ever visited. On arrival the staff were unclear and dismissive. The queue was unmanaged and slow moving with staff at JFK loudly voicing their surprise that so many people had arrived on an airplane which must arrive with the same numbers on a daily basis. On departures the lines were unmanaged once again with people cutting in and pushing while staff did their best to pretend they didn't see so they wouldn't have to deal with it. I was witness to one traveller verbally abuse another for "cutting in line" despite being told to go there. Staff looked on at the exchange and did not intervene. Pathetic. My bag required a second check after X-ray and I was stood for 30 minutes waiting for 1 of the 3 members of staff to check it. Once again staff were slow moving and in no hurry to check my bag. Their ability to pretend they could not see my bag or myself waiting was infuriating and I was rudely spoken to when I politely asked (after 20 minutes) if there was any possibility my bag could be checked. Eventually my bag was picked up by a member of staff who found the time to finish her conversation and then wave a wand over my bag before slinging it back to me, all without looking or speaking to me. As an experienced traveller and someone who prides himself on his polite conduct and ability to follow rules I was quite frankly disgusted with the behaviour of staff and their incredibly slow working capacity. I fully understand that safety is paramount and I am glad that bags be checked on a second or even third time if there is something unusual / suspicious but to be left standing for 30 minutes with nobody doing any checks is not the level of scrutiny I imagine you require.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Max Singer
reviewBody: New York JFK is a place of chaos - none of the staff seem to know where anything is, or what they have to do. Everybody sends you to another direction when you have questions or just want to check-in or get on board. In addition the staff are fast and rude in everything they are doing, and that ends in chaos, queues over queues everywhere, stressed passengers and delayed departures. When we wanted to fly back, we sat around 3 hours inside of the plane before departure - because there was even a queue on the runway.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'August 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "walked from the flight into absolute chaos"
author: S Cameron
reviewBody: The worst experience I have had in an airport. We arrived on Friday 14th October at 12.50pm at terminal 7. We walked from the flight into absolute chaos, hundreds of people in a small area with no idea where to go or what to do. One lady was shouting at all passengers to "make a line" but with no indication as to why and where. There were far too many people to form a queue so people just stood in a mass with no idea where to go. We stood like that with more and more people joining us from other flights for over an hour without moving at all. Eventually, after forming two lines we started to move slowly through customs two hours after arriving. Our line headed for the electronic machines where we were ordered by a second rude staff member to go to machine 12. We did so, entering all required information but when we tried to print the documents were told by the same lady with a shrug of her shoulders that the machine had no paper and we should use another machine. We eventually printed our documents from another machine but observed the same lady kept sending more customers to the machine with no paper.
