We then had to join another queue and when we were nearly at the front the customs officer at the desk got up and walked off, no idea why. We waited again to see another customs officer who took the same details and fingerprints we had just entered at the machine. Overall we spent over two and a half hours at customs and when we arrived at our apartment our host had left thinking we weren't coming. Please JFK, sort this out or we won't be back 😰, it ruined the start of our holiday.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "we were held for two and a half hours"
author: P Johnson
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Interestingly we went through on same date as a previous reviewer. We arrived at terminal 4 on 24th September. Having been through the British Airways terminal a number of years ago you are not prepared for your treatment at terminal 4. We are currently appealing a no show on our taxi company as we were held for two and a half hours through security. My only regret is that I did not ask for the person's ID and name as he was enjoying every minute of the delay he was causing. Can I suggest you get rid of all the people controlling the queues saving that expense in favour of a light and bell system where you are called individually by the desk operator then you don't get the situation we all had which was being directed by a staff member at the head of the main queue to desks where there were already queues and being stuck. Our operator then delighted in closing two desks either side where people were queuing and asking us to merge into one. He then got a query and went off to seek advice delaying it even further. Whilst I think we all appreciate the vigilance we also travelled recently through Paris CDG and London Heathrow both experiencing the same security issues as the US but without the grief experienced in your country. Further to my suggestion of a bell and lighting system perhaps the government could seek advice from every major bank or retailer who operates these systems very efficiently. Interestingly when departing terminal 4 two week later nothing was complicated.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Jayne Horwood
reviewBody: Our arrival at JFK can only be described as chaotic, we waited so long to get through the convoluted check out system that we missed our shuttle connection and had to wait for the next one which added another hour to our journey. My biggest bugbear with this airport is the staff. They never smile and spend far too much time shouting and gesticulating at hapless passengers which generally compounds the impression that you have entered the gateway to hell as opposed to a major international airport! On a good note our departure was a vastly improved experience with almost all staff (women I might add!) being pleasant,efficient and helpful. Only one male member of staff let the side down as he appeared to have lost the power of speech as he was only able to grunt and move his head in the general direction he wished us to proceed. The shops are poor as well. The airport could really do with an overhaul from top to bottom because as it stands it is an embarrassment to New York .
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Morrison
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Paris to New York and vice versa through JFK. Horrible experience. The treatment from most of the airport staff was quite degrading. In a previous comment somebody mentioned that, when going through security check, a woman was yelling 'they aint gonna load emselves' to the people so that they put their bags/items onto the conveyor. That is exactly what I heard too. I mean, what are we? Animals? Passport control was even worse. There was a woman there, looking completely unprofessional, that was yelling incoherently to the people to go where she was pointing at. At first, when I was still a bit farther away, I thought it was some crazy person and the security would pick her up, but it was indeed airport staff. Finally, I would imagine that the main airport for one of the biggest cities in the world would be spacious, but far from it; narrow corridors and a general claustrophobic environment.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'July 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: A Battye
reviewBody: I have been to JFK many times but the whole experience now is beyond a joke. We landed at JFK on 2nd September at around 16.00 after a 3.5 hour delay by American Airlines. The queue at Immigration was horrendous. There was total confusion, one woman walked up and down shouting at people incoherently which line they should be in, no-one understood her. There is no air-con in the hall and there must have been a thousand people in there waiting for no more than 6 desks to serve everyone and then one of those left. A few kind people let those with young children go to the front. It took over 2 hours to get through the queue and we had rushed to get near the front, heaven knows how long the poor people at the back had to wait. Get more people on the empty desks. There are dozens of them. We all paid $14 each for this. Once you finally get to a desk the staff are fine but the treatment of people worse than cattle beforehand is atrocious. The return trip was not much better, the staff at security were really rude. One woman kept shouting at people to put their bags onto the conveyer as 'they aint gonna load emselves' There is no need for the rudeness of the staff at JFK. A thoroughly unpleasant experience altogether. If I ever have to go to New York again I will travel to somewhere else first and get transport there rather than be subjected to the cattle like treatment at JFK.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'September 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Petar Petrovic
reviewBody: The JFK Terminal 4 seems like a run of the mill airport. There is really nothing that stands out about this airport in terms of architecture so it is rather unmemorable. However it doesn't mean it's bad, on contrary, it's easy and quick to navigate. A bit of a problem on arrival can be the fact that immigration control takes a lot of time, an hour or two even for some passengers, so when we reached the baggage claim finally our suitcases were already taken off the carousel. Staff were courteous and professional though. Terminal was very clean especially for its size. Available seating is comfortable enough to wait an hour or two before boarding and there is also a limited free wi-fi which won't be enough only if your flight is delayed. When it comes to food, the Terminal 4 has an average offer but the shopping options are slightly better, although not impressive. There was practically no queue at security control on departure.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'July 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: T Smethwick
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review | On arrival at New York JFK we were separated into queues - one for US citizens and one for foreigners. It took over an hour just to reach the ESTA machines. Due to poor signage, we asked what we should do with our little printouts from the machines and were directed along a corridor. Seconds later we were bellowed at by someone asking us to get back in the line. We explained that we'd been sent through but to no avail. We then collected our baggage and then we queued up to leave the airport and give another rude and sullen employee our stamped ticket. Altogether we had waited almost 2 hours. The taxi queue outside was unbelievable. Not due to lack of taxis but to the traffic chaos outside. Everyone for arrivals and departures are at the same place. Cars, buses, taxis with lanes constantly blocked by people stopping wherever they felt like it to unload / load etc. An employee ran up and down, yelling and blowing a whistle to keep the traffic moving. Nowhere is adequately signed e.g. Stand A, B etc. There is just one sign - Passenger Pick up and Drop off. I assume this means along the whole length of the airport. Hence no-one knows where exactly to wait. Everyone asked everyone else what to do. It was absolute chaos. In the queue for the taxi passengers further down were always trying to cut in but after an hour and a half wait, I couldn't blame them. From leaving the plane to getting a taxi took 3.5 hours. Overall the airport is poorly signed, with most monitors showing advertising instead of information. It is a challenge to find the toilets. Seating is limited and the whole atmosphere is stressful and unwelcoming. As for the airport staff - loud and rude is all that I can say. Never again, not even with a connecting flight.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'August 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Lazach
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  International arrival at JFK Terminal 7, transfer to a domestic flight - Terminal 8. JFK is the worst airport I have ever used, and I've used many. It is almost impossible to make a 3 hour layover as the lines to immigration go forever. You get out of the plane and the line starts already at gate entrance. There is no information what this line was for or what is going on. The only spoken announcements were initially in Spanish. Staff were rude and unhelpful. Took 2 hours to clear immigration, then 30 minutes to check in for the next flight. You need to claim your luggage before transfer. Made it only because my next flight was first delayed, then cancelled - something that happens frequently at JFK. My advice - if you can, use a different airport for your arrival into the US.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'August 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Theo Skagias
reviewBody:
✅ Verified Review | 
Considering it is an old airport and among the busiest ones in the world JFK is a good, convenient to use airport. When we landed there it was easy to get through passports (friendly staff) and suitcases arrived quickly. Taxis and transport to the city are easy to find. Departing was also easy with small ques and fast but efficient security control. Not the biggest variety of shops but good enough to spend some time. All in all a good experience.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'August 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 5, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Stephan Grütering
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  I flew with a group of my students to New York on a field trip. The last day, the pilots of Lufthansa went on strike. We got to JFK very early to make sure that we were rebooked on a different flight. The airline put us together on the SIA flight to Frankfurt. We had to change terminals going from 1 to 4 with all of our luggage and 5 teenagers who just lost their final day in NYC. After standing in line for more than 1.5 hours, we had to stand in line again for more than 2 hours. By the time we had checked-in, there was no going back to Manhattan. We passed security and hoped for the best. The typical food stands, Starbucks and Shake-a-Shack available. Most of the time they were bored to tears - so my advice, if you travel with boys between 15 and 18 do not get to JFK 4 hours prior departure. JFK has not been built for the A380 and the number of passengers. It is difficult to find available seating at their departure gates and this has happened to me with both LH and SIA.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'September 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: J Choo
reviewBody: I arrived in New York JFK Terminal 7 on the 22 July 2016 and departed from the same terminal on 29 July 2016. When I arrived at around 1030am, I think there was only one plane load of passengers who were queuing in line at immigration. Only US and Canadians were directed to use the automated computer terminals whereas all others have to queue for the traditional immigration clearance by the officers in person. The queues at the computer terminals cleared quickly but not for the queues waiting to be assessed by the officers. In my experience in other American airports, I could use the computer terminals being an ESTA holder which was a lot quicker. WiFi is readily available at the airport.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'July 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Atef Hanna
reviewBody: Worst experience and very rude TSA staff. My family and I were delayed in Madrid Spain for 1.5 hours which reduced our transit time in New York JFK to 90 minutes. As we were moving through the process an employee with TSA was taking her time checking duty free purchase and when I mentioned to her that we are 20 minutes away from our connecting flight, she purposely started slowing more and blamed us for being late as we were the ones causing the delay in Madrid. I will never use this airport again and encourage people to find other options.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'July 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Connor Holland
reviewBody: Overall, an average experience at this airport. I was at this airport when we arrived from the UK in New York, and when leaving again. When departing from NY we were faced with a huge queue getting through baggage and security etc, but very surprising, the crowds were managed very efficiently by staff, who seemed friendly and explained calmly and all instructions were very helpful. However, my main airport of use is Edinburgh, which is beyond perfect, but there is lots of places to sit and relax in cafes and lounges that are not at the departure gates. at JFK the only seating available were uncomfortable seating at departure gates, the only others were in the fancy restaurants which I did not want to go in as I den't want a 3 course meal. Some more seating and maybe a slightly cleaner airport would be nice. All considered, a half decent airport suited for the huge amounts of passengers with efficient ways of doing things and friendly staff.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'April 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Eric Muller
reviewBody: I dread arriving at JFK, especially going through security. Immigration is the worst. I have wanted to complain a number of times already, but now I really feel moved to say something. The lines at immigration are always so long. They have tried to speed up the process for American citizens, but not for the others, or people who have a green card. More officers need to be employed to check the passports, etc. There seems to be a lack of respect for the incoming travelers - certainly not welcoming. One feels treated like cattle (or prisoners). Some of the staff are officious and unwelcoming. However, I do have to say, that there are always some who try to be friendly - thank goodness. But this last time we were kept waiting for almost an hour. Some of the officials just got up and left without replacements, so we were stuck. There were families with children. It was torture for them. This could be avoided by employing more people and having a more efficient system. In short: JFK needs to be more welcoming and efficient.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'July 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: P Wipatavit
reviewBody: It was my first time flying into JFK and honestly I was fairly disappointed. I arrived on a Cathay Pacific flight early in the morning, terminal 7 was just quiet and gave an unwelcoming sense somehow. The terminal was old with closed space and no windows after arriving into the terminal from the jetbridge. There wasn't really any staff there to guide passengers around and signage was unclear. I had to meet up with my parents who were arriving on an Emirates flight into terminal 4. The internet connection took me some time to get as it kept cutting off, not allowing me to connect. There weren't many restaurants around and the things that were there didn't look too appetizing. Also, there weren't a lot of seats in the departure or arrival lounge, and with the busy nature of the airport, it was just chaotic just trying to find a place to stand. Overall, I would say, if you can, try to avoid this airport. The facilities are outdated and staff weren't really happy to help with needed.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'June 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Derek Coster
reviewBody: Everything went smoothly at New York JFK - going through the airport from taking the AirTrain from the subway to getting on the plane. Online check-in no doubt helps as did British Airways having Terminal 7 to themselves and other owned or code share airlines like Iberia and American Airlines. Clearing security is a bit of a pain as ever (where do they find such miserable staff to work at these places?) but has to be expected now. Only other let down was the supposed "English pub" the Trafalgar. Pretty slow service and worst of all the place closed without warning an hour before my flight was due to depart. 300 people waiting for a flight right next to the pub and they decide to shut up shop - hopeless. Still a minor point as I just upped and went to the other bar in the terminal.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'June 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 5, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Seating': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Shaishav Vora
reviewBody: I departed from JFK airport recently and it offers good amenities to its passengers. I used T4 and it had more than 20 restaurants / eating joints. It also offeres a host of duty free shops. Overall a good airport.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'June 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Simon Fowler
reviewBody: I've always been a bit scared of JFK, so avoided it in the past. But I was very impressed. The Airtrain from Jamaica was efficient and getting through security in Terminal 7 was a doddle (perhaps being business class helped) with efficient helpful TSA staff. There only appeared to be two gates working, which might have led to build ups come the evening rush of flights to the UK.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'June 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: K Ogorman
reviewBody: New York JFK is very disorganized. The immigration line was a long maze through barriers and hard to tell where US citizens, and non-citizens lines began or ended. The line was very slow, the hot room made it worse. There were too many unorganized steps. Most TSA lines in the US aren't as bad as JFK. JFK is a disgrace as a representative of the United States for so many visitors, and even natives. Staff are generally unfriendly if not mean. Even renovated, JFK is dirty and worn out. Seats in the shopping area were dirty, stained, worn out. We only fly in or out of JFK if there are no other possible ways of avoiding it.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'May 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: M Neave
reviewBody: I have had bad experiences at New York JFK before, and as usual long lines at immigration. They have added self service machines supposedly to speed things up - the queues look just as bad but luckily had a 2.5hr layover. When using the machine it takes all your passport details, takes your photo taken and this is printed on a paper slip which is handed to the immigration officer. This took me over an hour to get through, then I had to figure out how to get from terminal 4 to 2. Of course then I had to clear security again which took another 45mins. After a 7hr flight I was hoping to have a meal and something to drink - no chance, I was lucky to make my connecting flight, last time I will use JFK when flying to the US.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'April 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Tung
reviewBody: Used JFK (T7) on a British Airways flight for the first time. Before arrival I heard a lot of stories about rude staff, long queues and confusing signs so I wasn't expecting a lot. Arrived at JFK after midday. At the time there was a flight from Madrid that landed slightly before my flight. Despite being the first person out of the plane the queue in immigration had built up. The line became very long once all passengers from both flights disembarked. There was a guy directing people to the queue so it was pretty much in order. It was hot without sufficient air con but it's bearable. There were a few staff calling transist passengers or American citizens and directing them to the right queue. They were robotic but definitely not rude as people describe. Maybe I arrived at the right time slot? The immigration officer was also friendly. My departure was at the evening peak hours (traffic was really bad so bear that in mind). Check in was done by very friend ground agent. There was a long queue for security check but it moved quickly. No hostile attitude as people have mentioned. The terminal is fairly small with limited shops and restaurants. The souvenirs in the shop are actually much cheaper than what you pay in New York. The downside of the airport is that there isn't sufficient seating.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'May 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Dan Elliker
reviewBody: JFK is probably the most uninviting airport I have ever flown into, customs and border control moved fairly quickly, agree with other reviews and let's just say the staff are not exactly welcoming. What really surprised me was the lack of food outlets, not everyone is on the move straightaway we were waiting to be picked up, lack of seating is a problem too. As others have said it's unbearably hot no air at all and it's only May. Dread to think what it's like in the summer. Next time will use Newark again it's better for all the above reasons location wise it's better too.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'May 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Pearl Winchester
reviewBody: New York JFK offers the worst connection and transit handling. You have to go through immigration just for transit, waiting twice there, then through customs, so another wait, then take your bag to go through the exit, to give it back just on the other side of the exit door. Change terminals to get through security again, which means showing your passport and boarding pass to at least two official people again. Of course, everytime you have to show some papers and so there was a huge line-up, at least 20 people each time. A 2h43 min layover, I made it to my aircraft 5 minutes before the boarding time. No time to stop for some shopping. Of course the security and customs and immigration officers are not friendly at all. A useless maze of administrative nonsense and sadly this is the same in every airport of USA. I wish I could avoid flying through USA altogether.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'May 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 5, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Dan Horton
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Terrible. The security area was congested. It took 50 minutes to get through security. Customs and immigration was even more congested and disorganized. It took 50 minutes to get through. This was a contrast to Heathrow which was calm and took only a few minutes and there is free wifi at Heathrow. According to Wikipedia, Heathrow handles a larger number of passengers.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'April 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: E A Mcsweeney
reviewBody: Terminal 5 - unpleasant and chaotic experience. We arrived at 5pm for a 9pm flight thinking we had plenty of time, having left the city early more out of concern for rush hour traffic. Check-in was smooth enough, but then the trouble began. The queue for security took over two hours, they kept decanting passengers from one queue to another and people were getting increasingly stressed and aggressive as they feared missing their flights (I'm sure some of them did). We thought that the delays were due to strictness at the security check, we were shocked when we eventually got there that we were not required to do the minimum usually needed, like taking out liquids and electronics, taking off shoes and belts etc. I know it's a pain, but it is reassuring. There were no trays available just put the bag on the conveyor belt as is and the staff screamed at anyone who started to take laptops etc out. Never seen anything like it, got the impression that they were completely overwhelmed and disorganised. would expect that an airport serving one of the world's major cities would at least have the security check properly organised, not the chaos we found. Once through, there was very little, a couple of tacky souvenir shops, a bar and a newsagent, all vastly overpriced. Will be looking to LaGuardia or Newark next time.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'April 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Albert Wong
reviewBody: JFK in New York is more like many airports built in one area rather than one airport, for each major airline has its own terminal. The standard of terminals varies, but none up to the high standard of an important airport you expect. Shopping is virtually not available. The last Terminal I used was the AA terminal, where they charge money for some food items against the norm of a normal lounge. Transportation is varied but you almost need to be an expert to know what to use. The fact that there are too many terminals make each terminal minimalist.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'February 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Filippo Fulloni
reviewBody: Very good. I was traveling from Rome and transiting to go to Montreal. The transit time was 8 hrs, but due to the fact I was traveling in business on the first leg I was able to go through customs checks faster and so I had plenty of time to spend and shop.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'April 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Geoffrey Baker-Hytch
reviewBody: Arrival at JFK from Frankfurt around 21:30 on Friday evening; we had a powerful and immediate sense of hostility from airport staff who barked orders at us; there is no smooth system of filtering passengers; many passengers feel, like us, confused and dazed - what's going on? why is this line not moving? Even some US citizens were caught up in the immigration lines because they were not shown through; there were frequently discourteous shouts for us to get in a single file, keep to the right, keep up, stay back, don't move yet, have this ready - when we eventually (after 3/4 hour) emerged into the main 'queuing pen' we could see roughly half of all the security checking positions were closed at a time when three large planes had just arrived! In this snaking queue we took a further 1.5 hours to reach the immigration officer. As we presented our UK / European Union passports the officer snapped questions at us: where are you from? Where are you staying? Why are you going there? Only when we said we would be at Notre Dame University did we get a flicker of human warmth! There were more US Homeland Security officers 30 metres further on who were even more intimidating and unfriendly: sarcastic, arrogant, rude; we came off relatively well - a small group of Chinese visitors got very rough treatment. Anyway, they were ordered to get into two groups and marched off somewhere - and New York aspires to be the most visited city in the world!! That was arrival at JFK - our departure from the USA, 3 weeks later was worse! On our journey home from the Midwest, JFK was our transit airport; we'd had a very easy, trouble-free short early morning flight from South Bend (IN) to Newark, took the frequent (and reasonably-priced) NYC Airporter bus service to JFK, and settled down to a patient wait till around 4 to check-in; no problem, plenty of time, no need to rush. We took turns to check the monitors for boarding information. Appreciating that it's a busy time of day to travel, we tried to queue over an hour before necessary - just to be sure of being in good time - Gate 9, the overhead display showed. Gates 1 to 8 are marked, in order - no Gate 9. Altogether we asked 5 different airport staff about this; replies ranged from 'I don't know' to 'it's all the same' to nothing because they had insufficient English! So, we dutifully waited in an undifferentiated snaking queue. This was so densely packed that it was very hot (outside air temp only 8 degrees C) - small children got very fractious; some elderly people looked distressed; a fight nearly broke out when one passenger (accidentally) barged another. The numerous airport staff just looked on, or looked away! None of them seemed to realise that passengers needed to be sorted according to their flight's departure time! It was only pure luck that we got through security checking exactly at the moment that the last call for boarding our flight went out! The airport's damned chaotic, inefficient systems had almost made us miss a flight which we'd arrived for 6 hours ahead! I don't actually blame the 'foot soldiers' - the lowly airport staff are hopeless but they're probably on minimum wage and get zero training! Surely one of the main functions of any airport, of any size, is to enable passengers to arrive and depart safely, comfortably, and punctually!!
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'April 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Derrick Galloway
reviewBody: Terminal 7 was a nightmare. On arrival the immigration process was over 1 hour 30 mins. Not all desks were in use. Apparently three large planes arrive about the same time. A large number of passengers in the queue did not speak English so gave the officers printed pieces of paper to read when initially given instructions by the officers. This slowed the process considerably. The aircon did not cope with the heat. At other airports in the US they have APC machines to process visitors which really cuts down the time taken to clear immigration and do the job efficiently. They are needed at JFK. On departure the Fast Track security check did not live up to it`s name. Only one machine is available in what looks like a corridor. Most planes leave in the evening so a large number of passengers are checking in. Once more the aircon did not cope efficiently. JFK is to be avoided if there is an alternative.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'April 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: D Lee
reviewBody: We had one aborted landing after the New York air traffic controllers got their timings wrong. Once we finally did arrive, we had to queue for over an hour to get through customs. However it was our departure that was really shocking. The staff at the airport were so rude and aggressive to everyone. They shouted at the elderly who couldn't walk fast enough and made sarcastic remarks if anyone didn't understand what they were supposed to do. The whole system was a shambles, completely disorganised with no clear instructions and certainly no assistance. We were shocked by the staff, who seemed intent on upsetting anyone and everyone. Even simple things like having a table to put your tray on once through security was missed - you had to put your shoes back on, belt, jumper, coat, watch, put your computer back in it's bag and collect your bags at the bottom of a staircase with the tray on the floor, as they shouted at you to remove it from the conveyor belt as soon as it was through the scanner. I would avoid this airport in the future.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'April 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Mike Saunders
reviewBody: Arrived at Terminal 7 at 3pm. It was like an easyJet queue at Gatwick. The queue was massive and moved exceedingly slowly. It took over an hour to check in and then there was the queue for security. There is nothing like New York for rudeness so this was not unexpected. We were impressed at the drinks prices, $20 for a beer and a cider. Altogether it aws not a good experience at all.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'April 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Albert Wong
reviewBody: The AA terminal at JFK has had some useful renovations and is now good. There is a special area for Elite members, with good service. The lounge is decent and immigration and security efficient. I hated JFK before but now it is not bad. The arrival was good too, they have a semi-automated system for a passenger like me, with a visa-waver passport. It is not a fancy airport like in Asia or the Middle East but it is good.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'January 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Frederick Moses
reviewBody: I cannot say enough bad things about JFK airport. The staff in Terminal 4 were rude and treated all incoming passengers poorly. The airport itself is outdated and an embarrassment to the great state of New York. I felt disgraced for even asking the attendant at the luggage pick up where my suitcase might be, he grumbled at me, stating "you don't even know your own flight". Terrible service, especially after coming back home from Taiwan where everyone was respectful and courteous, even if they didn't speak your language.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Louise Wallace
reviewBody: Worst arrival experience in any country I have visited due to the hostile and aggressive manner of the immigration officer. I witnessed this employee shouting and being sarcastic to other travellers and unfortunately experienced the same from him myself. He was openly intimidating towards me. Had he been civil towards passengers I am sure that people would have been processed in a quicker timescale. Instead his attitude caused confusion in taking the digital finger prints. It was a horrible first impression of New York, such a shame as everyone else I met in the city was really pleasant. The US need to consider some customer care training of its officers.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'March 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Ginsberg
reviewBody: At New York JFK as I was going through security, there were many passengers there who clearly did not understand English or the confusing security procedures we were required to go through and the staff had absolutely no patience for them. Confused looks were met with insulting and sarcastic remarks from staff. It was a very unpleasant and threatening environment and an extremely negative experience. It felt more like a prison than an airport due to the openly hostile attitudes and inappropriate behaviour of the staff.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'July 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Mia Kim
reviewBody: I am not a citizen but I currently live in US through a visa. Whenever I arrive at New York JFK airport, I have to go though passport control. Last time I went through it took me an hour and a half even though I was near the front of the line. They seem to take about 10 min per person and only about 4 lanes were open out of 15. I can't imagine how long it would have taken for people at the back of the line. I usually use JFK for its cheaper flight even though I live in Boston but I'll be using Logan airport for sure next time I have to go out of the country.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'March 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Anne Ninham
reviewBody: We (83 year old dad and I) arrived on March 3rd on a delayed London Heathrow flight and had to queue in a hot "tunnel" for 1 hour and 50 minutes with hundreds of other passengers waiting to clear customs. What a nightmare - no information was given but it turned out there were only 2 operatives for incoming passengers from 3 jumbos. Woefully inadequate procedures and staff and not very friendly when we did get to speak with anyone. On our departure from JFK on March 7th the procedures weren't much better - contradictory instructions about what to take off or not which led to a very agitated father. I won't be back at JFK even if it means travelling with a different airline and I would not recommend to friends or family. Too hot, too unfriendly and too long to process visitors to the USA. Too bad you are advertised as the face of the nation.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'March 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: LJB Persaud
reviewBody: Big horrible airport - avoid JFK at all costs if you can. It is very inconvenient and far away from the city. Being in transit is horrible. There are no airport employees to help direct passengers when you get off the plane. Every man for himself. Big, horrible and zero customer service.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'February 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: M Entwisle
reviewBody: Overall a pretty good experience and much better than I had feared. Arrived mid evening on a BA flight from London into T7. No queues at immigration (contrast my last trip into NY where I waited for over an hour at EWR) and pleasant staff. Baggage was slow as seems to be the custom across the USA. Took the air train and then the Subway into NYC, the subway wait was around 20 mins which was a bit dull. Departed on an 0830 flight a few days later from T7. Again no queues to speak of. Main issues were that many outlets are closed early morning and the inattentive Duty Free staff managed to get my purchases taken to the wrong flight. This took a while to resolve which was more than a bit frustrating. Only 30 Mins free wifi - take note and plan your access carefully.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'February 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 5, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Keith Andrews
reviewBody: What a nightmare this place is. We had a 4 hour layover to change connecting flighs SXM-LHR. It took 3 hours to get through immigration at term 8 because they only had 2 officers on duty, yes 2. The assistance staff were useless as one of them told us we didn't need a customs form for transit but when we got to the front we realised we did, fortunately we had one already filled in otherwise we would have been sent back to the line. We only just made our connecting flight with about 20 minutes to spare and nobody at the airport could have given a damn about it. BA were paging us as the flight was overbooked and we couldnt find anyone willing to help us make our connection, we were on our own big time. This airport is the worst I have ever been through, limited seating areas at T7, grubby and dated with unhelpful staff. I will never transit or go to JFK again, I would rather fly through EWR, much better place.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'February 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Cristiana Pegoraro
reviewBody: JFK is a very passenger friendly airport. Terminal 1 has been enriched by nice stores, ideal for last minute shopping. The personnel at the Alitalia counters is polite and helpful. The Alitalia lounge is nice, with friendly atmosphere and good selection of snacks and drinks. Embarking procedures are always fast and smooth.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'January 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

header: "could use more outlets on the seats"
author: Laura Powers
reviewBody: I was stuck in B terminal during this January's crazy blizzard. I had a lot of time there since I was stuck at the airport for almost 48 hours. This terminal is pretty good though they could use more outlets on the seats, more comfy seats without bars in the middle and healthier eating options. I can't eat wheat and sugar so all I could eat was salads which gets very tiring after a while. You get free wifi for 30 minutes so at least so that was something positive.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'January 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Andrew Streit
reviewBody: I flew into JFK with Delta Connection, arriving in terminal 4. The terminal was very clean, and I was able to find my way around due to the clear signage. I had to change terminals to terminal 1 because my connection flight was with Air France. There wasn't any clear signage to about where to go to change terminals, but I had already looked that up beforehand. I took the AirTrainJFK to terminal 1, and had to go through security again, which was a bit taxing. However once I got into the terminal everything was okay. The only problem was a lack of good wifi in the terminal. Also there was only one charging station by the gate for an airplane that seats about 300, so every single socket was taken. However overall I enjoyed my experience at JFK, despite the process of changing terminals. I recommend a secure passenger transportation method to move between the terminals.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'January 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Shopping': 5, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: J Tooker
reviewBody: I was at the airport in December for my flight to Mexico via terminal 8. I had a lot of trouble finding seats for my family of 5 even though I arrived at the gate 2 hours before my flight. This is due to having very little seating overall. The food choices are good but they are so expensive. It is relatively clean for the most parts but some bathrooms can get a little dicey. The lines for everything are very long. Takes minimum of 30 minutes to get through check in then add another 30 for security. And that's on a very good day for the airport. (I fly through there a lot and have had to wait for hours before). With the new machines in place, customs lines for US Citizens are very pleasant and short though I can not speak for those of foreign visitors. Staff are very average overall. The wifi is exponentially better than most airports I have flown into. That is a huge bonus for me and the rest of my family. Shopping has a very good selection but it to is very costly and many of the stores swindle you for money every chance they get. Overall it's an average experience traveling through JFK airport.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'December 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: T Denby
reviewBody: Nice clean modern terminal (4) with plenty of shops, duty free, restaurants and bars. Nice selection although a lot of designer shops and expensive bars. We found a nice relaxed irish bar and had food in the buffalo wings restaurant. Gate service fine plenty of comfortable leather seats. 30mins free wifi available. Boarded the plane on time but due to late passengers and loosing our slot we departed late. First time i have seen TSA joking and being friendly, usually very stern. A lot of security checks I guess because of recent events but that didnt bother us knowing we felt safer.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'January 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: David Neilson
reviewBody: New York JFK airport is an absolute disgrace. Arrived at 5:20pm for our 9:05 flight. Queue for bag drop was horrendous. 1:50 minutes it took us to drop our bags. Only 7 check in staff for over a thousand passengers with 5 flights going out within an hour of each other. Disgraceful.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'January 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: James Corbett
reviewBody: Arriving at JFK T7 is like stepping back into the 1970s - it really is a shabby, cramped and generally unpleasant experience, not helped by huge border control queues. The contrast with our departure airport, Heathrow T5, was unfortunate to say the least. On the plus side, on the return trip, the check-in process at T7 was relatively easy, and as the terminal is quite small, walking distances are low. Security was chaotic and staff were pretty rude. After security, food and shopping options air-side were poor, and the loos offer very little privacy. Not impressed.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'December 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Marianne Bonner
reviewBody: First time at JFK in years. Not at all impressed. Virtually no seating in check-in area. While airports are not known for bargains, JFK' price-gouging shops and eateries were obscene. Cold and uninviting. The two bright spots: a very friendly gate agent and remarkably fast and courteous passage through US Customs coming back. Would much prefer to fly in and out of Philadelphia, if only the airlines would stop adding hundreds for the convenience.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Paul Ginnifer
reviewBody: Arrived at JFK on time and docked straight away, walk to Immigration was was very short, a nice surprise. Actually found a queue-less security booth. We forgot to fill in customs declaration so were pointed to one of the queue marshals who had loads of spares. Filled in form and then went straight through security. Very easy no questions what so ever. Baggage arrived very quickly. Longest wait was 5 minutes for a taxi. Going home Taxi journey from Manhattan was awful rush hour in the rain. Got dropped of at correct check in area and were through to security in minutes. Huge snake like queue so long that I thought we would miss the plane but it was very deceptive. It was very quick moving and 15 minutes later we were airside. Although bit of confusion re my belt and titanium hip although we were all smiling. Looked around duty free got a drink an ambled to out gate. Easy.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'December 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Seating': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Staff': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Michael Bobker
reviewBody: Arrival on 17th December into Terminal 4 was good, immigration and customs all swift. Departure was a shambles. We had to wait in a very long line for security for over 20 minutes. I have travelled through JFK Terminal 4 numerous times and never had to wait this long.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'December 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: A Lai
reviewBody: We arrived into JFK terminal 7 on Jan 1 at 11pm after a 15 hour flight from HK. The line awaiting customs was not very long, and we hoped, as US citizens, it would be speedy. We were shuffled by a BA Terminal 7 employee (white shirt thus not a customs officer) over to a line to wait for an agent. After several minutes it became clear there were computer issues for the traveler in line. After 10 minutes, while many of the other lines were moving along, I asked the same BA employee to move us to a different line. He said fine but he had to move the 2 groups ahead of us before he moved us, which was fair. He did so, but despite many other lines being available, he did not move us. He had the audacity to tell me to "calm down" and that "I was not in the US yet." We had to wait another 10 minutes before the customs agent logged into another computer.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'January 2016', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: David Romero
reviewBody: 6:30 pm International Terminal 7, JFK, 12/21/2015. Waiting for 9:00pm departure. This airport is pathetic, a shameful representative of the USA. It is worse than many third world airports. There are not enough seats for all the people waiting. People are sitting on the floor everywhere. Everybody is helplessly accepting the situation as "Oh well, what do you expect".  There's no pride evidenced here and there is nothing 21st century here except the pay phones are gone.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'December 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: James Costa
reviewBody: Massively under staffed. Almost missed our flight. We allowed ourselves 1.5 hours to travel domestically. Biggest mistake ever. In most counties all you need is max 45 mins, not in the US. The security check had 3 conveyor belts/scanners going and they shut one down. The queue was growing, and at one stage no one was passing through. It was one of the worst airports in the world I have delt with. Management do something - one of the biggest airports in the world, maybe have 10 security check scanners going, not 2.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'December 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Wagner
reviewBody: It seems that every time I return to New York via this airport there is something new and it is not good. The last time I returned from Asia the computers went down at immigration and the officer was rude and obviously annoyed with everything and everybody. This time on my return I cannot complain about the officer but who was the bright mind that decided that citizens should now be sent to the same line as non-citizens? That was terribly frustrating as we had to wait forever for visitors to be fingerprinted etc. it makes no sense. After a very long flight all we older folks want is to get home. What nonsense. Wise up, JFK. The lines did not go faster because of this new silly change.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: P Charasz
reviewBody: What an awful experience at New York JFK Airport. I arrived in Terminal 1. The plane waited for 1 hour on the tarmac for a gate to be assigned. Then it took me 2hrs 10min to clear immigration and an extra 20 min to collect my luggage, all that while standing in line with no drinking water available. There were 9 counters open serving thousands of people who have just arrived on transcontinental flights. I almost missed my next flight. Luckily, it was delayed. The transfer between terminals was another awful experience. I will never again fly into JFK when entering the US.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'August 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: John Bradley
reviewBody: Overall a good experience. For arrival, immigration in T4 was bustling but as I'm a fairly frequent visitor to the US I was able to use the automated machines. These are quite easy to use but can understand less frequent travellers frustration as the photo and fingerprint scans were tricky. Did not have to queue for long for my passport stamp or at customs and as I didn't have checked baggage I was outside in less than 20 minutes (this was around 6.45pm). Departure was also from T4, security processing took about 15-minutes, TSA staff were generally agreeable, which is about as good as one can expect nowadays. Airside shopping experience pretty uninspiring and the departure concourse is a bit dingy and dimly lit. Most seats have power which is a bonus but free WiFi allowance is a paltry 30 minutes and then you have to pay. Overall, quite satisfied - could not fault the arrival, and departure is fine as long as you don't have too much time to kill prior to your flight.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'December 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: A D Goodwin
reviewBody: I was surprised at the TSA staff. Some of them were in need of a major overhaul of attitude. No interest in assisting the already confused foreigners and US citizens. It wasn't everyone, but certain people. Food was expensive once you'd gone past security in the terminal that we were in and had only one choice that I was aware of.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'December 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "1 hour to get through inefficient immigration"
author: Mary Cameron
reviewBody: Landing at 8.30pm from London, 30 minutes earlier than scheduled, it took 1 hour to get through the inefficient immigration check. The questions asked by the officer were ridiculous. Where are you travelling from? Do you live there? How long have you lived there? What is the purpose of your visit to the US? Where are you staying? Where do you work? What is your job there? Have you travelled to the US before? When? Have you travelled to any other countries in the past 3 weeks? Have you travelled to West Africa in the past 3 weeks? Followed by more ridiculous Q&A read directly from the form. All served up with a "you are most certainly not welcome to America attitude." In the meantime our luggage was piled up on the carousel for anyone to pick up and walk off with. The hypocrisy and harassment of this "procedure' is further illuminated as you step outside the arrivals hall and are greeted by touting unofficial taxi drivers and a total absence of security personnel. For travellers with health related conditions and small children - be prepared to "stand in line" for a long time without access to any seating or toilets whilst waiting for your "interview".
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'November 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Kuhan Kandiah Chelvanathan
reviewBody: New York JFK Airport, Terminal 8. The arrival is quite swift and clear. Airport lacks food outlets at the departure and arrival level before/after security clearance. The transit area is alright for food outlets but announcements are very unclear and can be improved, especially so when there is announcement for a delay or final call. Overall Terminal 8 is alright.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: R Arnett
reviewBody: Terminal 5. Pretty fast through security on departure. Good range of shops and facilities. Trolleys are a total rip off at US$6.00 a pop. Absolutely ridiculous greed by Airport authorities. Explains why most people carrying own luggage. If you have to charge then make it a reasonable price and you will get more revenue. Decent airports do not charge. Car pick up a shambles with two/three ineffectual wardens more keen on blowing their whistles than actually controlling flow of traffic.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'November 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Aldrian Suherman
reviewBody: I was at Terminal 7 at JFK. It was quite disappointing the quality of this terminal. My arrival experience at JFK was also not that great. After a 14 hour flight, the last thing you want is long queues and I had to wait 1.5 hours just to get through immigration. There was not much space with narrow hallways at the arrival hall as well. This being the first time at JFK airport, I expected the departure hall to be much better. However, I was so surprised to see the size of Terminal 7 departure hall. It was very small when compared to the gigantic size of an airport JFK is. Terminal was lacking of glamour and excitement too - it was dull. Shops were not interesting and the terminal felt somewhat empty. There were some food retail, but not a great selection of them.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'December 2014', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Antonio Bellamy
reviewBody: JFK has done some upgrading in some recent years which was much needed, however still has issues with being clean and rude people. Love visiting New York but I would rather go to La Guardia than JFK because of easier access to the city. But to be honest both airports need to be overhauled.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'December 2014', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Aviva Evron
reviewBody: The worst airport experience ever! When arriving to terminal 7 after 15 hours travel (with a stop in Madrid) from Israel we just stood in a line for more than two hours to have our passports stamped. There is no place to sit in this long queing and nothing to drink. Some people were just sitting on the floor. The airport experience was bad in an other way. We had to pay 25$ for a taxi from the car rent in the terminal to the terminal itself, and then 6$ for a trolley for the suitcases. Transport shouldn't be free? Trolleys shouldn't be free? Since we were hungry we met the ugly greediness of the food shops; 9-13.5$ for a simple sandwich! 13$ for a simple pre-made salad with a piece of cheese! Please don't come to this airport when hungry. By the way, they always ask you 'how are you', but it does not mean they care even a little about you. It is realy a pity this is the first and the last view of the US.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Torsten Krahn
reviewBody: After reading many bad reviews about JFK I was surprised in a positive way. Immigration was very fast and effective, 15 minutes after we left the plane we passed the imigration, the civil servant was neither rude nor friendly, did only his job. After we claimed our luggage we passed the customs and proceeded to the ground transportation deck, where we arranged the shuttle service to our hotel. It took 45 minutes after landing to leave the airport.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 5, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: T L Amm
reviewBody: The security check at terminal 7 is confusing for first time users and the staff at the security check point were rude and yell at you for making mistakes. The staff at the McDonalds were sullen and unfriendly. Seems like everyone in that airport is in a bad mood.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Paul Dale
reviewBody: This was our first trip to New York and having read lots of bad reviews about JFK we were worried and not looking forward to the experience. We landed at 16:00 on Friday of the Columbus day holiday weekend and were out of the airport an hour or so later. The immigrations / customs staff we met was polite and efficient. The same was true on our departure, we were quickly through security and had plenty of time to have a meal and drink. I have to say my first experience of New York JFK was excellent.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 5, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 5, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Mounts
reviewBody: Worst experience in an airport. Arrived late at night after a 14 hour flight from Hong Kong. Baggage check and security closed, open at 3 am. Had to sit in the hard cold floor for hours waiting for the staff to arrive because of no seating. Staff at counter and TSA were rude and inefficient. There is no designated TSA Precheck line so I had to take off my shoes. Limited WIFI, no food vendors were open. Terrible experience. Never again.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "Welcome to America it most certainly was not"
author: M Keates
reviewBody: I have never experienced such chaos and rudeness in my life. A two hour queue with staff barking orders to people in a way that really didn't say welcome to America at all. We were tired, we were thirsty and we were stuck in a long, long queue, a smile or two would have been nice. When we got to the front of the queue we were greeted by the most obnoxiously rude woman it has ever been my displeasure to meet. We'd watched her taking what seemed like forever to deal with the people in the queue in front of us. She looked red in the face and harassed and I felt a little sorry for her. For some reason our queue seemed to be moving far slower than the ones around us and I thought, maybe, she was new. The people before us were eventually done and moved away so I moved forward only to be shouted at. "I didn't call you. Go back behind the line and wait until I say. It's going to be a long time." At this point I'd have turned round and got a plane out of there right then if I could. Eventually, after she felt she'd kept us and all the people behind us waiting long enough she called us forward with a glare. There was no greeting, no smile, just a barked, "why have you come here?" spat in what sounded like an accusation. "Holiday," I said. What I wanted to say was 'right now I have no idea but I rather wish I hadn't.' "How long." "Three days," suddenly three days seemed about two days twenty three and a half hours too long. "Right hand. Four fingers on the green light," was the next command, followed by "thumb." Then it was all repeated with the other hand. Not a please or thank you to be heard and all the while she glared at us. Welcome to America it most certainly was not.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Marie Wayne
reviewBody: It looks like Kennedy has added self serve computers to your travel experience, in doing so they have cut back on the staff within the airport. There are long lines that are not distributed well to your final destination, staff members giving out incorrect of unhelpful answers to questions. All in all a terrible travel experience at Kennedy.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 5, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: H Stewart
reviewBody: This is the busiest airport on earth. What a dire experience. You have just spent 7+ hours flying from Heathrow to be welcomed by some of the most hostile, lazy and disorganised border control I have ever encountered. To hear one of the officers broadcast that he was going on his break was a joke, at least do it discreetly and get someone to cover him. I am a seasoned traveller and have previously travelled to Chicago, they were slicker and far more friendly. I knew it was going to be trouble at border control, four officers for the 100 or so US citizens, four officers for the 600+ international line. As we were told 3 long haul flights got in within 20 minutes of each other. Ludicrous, have more staff to accommodate the greater demand. You are barked at by the most patronising, power happy lot I have ever come across. Is that a pre-requisite to getting a job with border control? These are the first faces that international travellers see, put your best people here. Just to get our passports checked took an hour and 30 minutes. This is poor, I've travelled through Sydney, Bangkok and Auckland in half the time. This is your flagship airport, it is in the dark ages. Terminal 7 is a disgrace, it is in massive need of an upgrade. It was unclean and tiny. You have much to learn from Heathrow.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 1, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: B Robinson
reviewBody: Appalling 3 hr wait at Passport Control. Like many other reviews on here we experienced the 3 hr wait to clear Passport control at JFK. This is the worst passport experience that I have ever come across. In comparison when I returned to the UK it took half hour from stepped off the plane to walking out of the airport, and that was also stopping to get coffee. There were only four staff manning the passport control and around eight staff barking orders on which line to get in and where to go. It was absolute chaos, flights kept arriving and the queue got longer and the staff constantly reminded that it was for 'security' During our stay in NYC we visited Ellis Island, it seemed easier to access the USA 200 years ago with an infection than it did to clear JFK in this modern age. Well done JFK.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'September 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "line through Customs was long and chaotic"
author: N Altman
reviewBody: I flew to Tokyo Narita and back from Terminal 1 with JAL. Departure was at 9am and check-in and security were fast. Several post-security dining options and decent duty-free shopping. Return is easy and fast for US citizens, though not for international visitors, who had to wait in a huge line. As a US Passport holder, I was directed to a group of Automated Passport Control kiosks that made immigration quick and easy. However, we arrived at Baggage Claim way before our baggage was delivered. There was no listing for our JAL flight baggage claim location on the terminal's screens, but JAL placed signs at various locations in the area instead. Easy to miss. After picking up baggage, the line through Customs was long and chaotic, with agents running around and shouting orders at passengers. I would recommend Terminal 1 for American citizens, but not for international visitors.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'October 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Carole Barratt-Smith
reviewBody: New York JFK Airport is the worst airport I have ever been to, and the first airport where I have not been able to purchase duty free - because my international flight departs from terminal 2 (domestic terminal). Very poor.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'September 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Wifi Connectivity': 3, 'Airport Staff': 5, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Karen Markham
