reviewBody: Having landed for our first trip in New York we were excited to start exploring but our first experience was dreadful. A 3 hour queue through passport control. Very poorly staffed and slow computers, no air conditioning. Not the best way to start a holiday.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'September 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Latsh
reviewBody: Worst experience ever with TSA, we were flying in from Rome and trying to get to our connecting flight, we had 2 hours and we didn't make it due to the chaos in security, TSA employees were rude and horribly disorganized. Isn't it their responsibility to move thousands of international travelers through security, don't they know how many flights are coming in daily and can guess at the number of people and the number of employees needed to do the job they are supposed to? TSA definitely doesn't do the job expected if them.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'September 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 5, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: VT Tang
reviewBody: New York JFK is an outdated airport with poor quality and choice of shops and restaurants. Terminals were dark and cramped. Queues were long, exacerbated by low numbers of uninterested and unfriendly staff. Wifi is spotty and only avaliable for 30 minutes. Only one security checkpoint was open which doesn't help speed up the stringent security procedures of America. A poor introduction and conclusion to one of the world's leading cities.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'September 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Wifi Connectivity': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "it will definitely make us think twice before returning"
author: Pauline Balem
reviewBody: After a pleasant 7 hour flight from the UK we arrived in the security hall of terminal 8 to a massive queue. We passed through security 3.5 hrs later. There are 32 desks available but there were never more than 6 in use at any one time. There are posters in front of each desk stating that border control is the "public face" of the USA. Yet this mismanagement seems to be deliberately designed to upset foreign visitors before we even enter the country. We have visited the states several times before and immigration has always been bad, but this time they have beaten their own record. It will definitely make us think twice before returning to New York JFK.

author: Matthew Bates
reviewBody: New York JFK Airport. Arrival, no problem. Departure, the design of the terminal (8) was terrible. Signage was poor and seemed primarily concerned with Priority and executive travellers. There seemed no advantage to checking in online and printing off boarding passes prior to arrival. If anything, we waited longer. One, single, very long line to security. Bins were not for bags and shoes but it made it difficult for them to go through the machine. Minimal shopping and dining once inside.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: J Ludewig
reviewBody: We arrived in a crowded immigration hall. Though not the first time with ESTA in the US, we chose the line for First time ESTA as it was rather empty unlike the other. No one cared. We got thru the process fairly fast for JFK, less than 30 minutes. Last time it took me 2 hours. Line to get the bags checked (though we had carry on only) was very long then, so was the taxi line, which was 40 minutes. The airport has a bad connection to Downtown, we made like a sightseeing tour thru Brooklyn on small streets with traffic. Flying back was a little easier, terminal 4 with priority boarding was a no brainer, Delta lounge was ok. Still Newark might be the better option for NYC.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'August 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: Stefano Pisani
reviewBody: We are a family of 5 with a 6 year old child and we arrived at 4pm after a 9 hour flight on a normal working day Monday. We had to wait for 3 hours and 15 minutes for passport security check. I understand the need for security but what has really upset me and all the rest of the folks in the queue is the fact that most of the counters for non US citizens were closed and number of incoming flights and passegers is obviously something that can be planned in advance. If all the counters had been open the wating time would have been something reasonable. Honestly I see this as a total lack of respect for tourists, since I do understand that it requires more personnel to have all counters open but this should be compared with the hours lost by thousands of passengers. Ironically during these 3 hours we had screens showing passport control images with no queues and smiling people all around. Once security checks were completed we had to search for our luggage that was scattered around the belts since clearly we couldn't collect it in time. Disorganization at JFK was amazing and an incredibly poor image was given by US upon entering the country and this is even stranger considering that in all the rest of the trip in the US (for example in the National Parks) I found an excellent organization and very helpful people. Security officers were kind and surely it is not them to blame for this.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'August 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: Rory Ayres
reviewBody: Flew with KLM from terminal 4 at JFK. Glad that KLM codeshares with Delta, as it meant being able to use Delta's newly refurbished terminal 4, which is very good. JFK gets a lot of bad press but it is easily accessible via the subway from Manhattan (Brooklyn in my case), then by Airtrain to the terminal itself, even if the entry fee for the latter is a bit steep at $5. Newark's is better as it tells you which airlines serve which terminal, although for JFK it's advisable to just look out the window. The interior of terminal 4 itself is spacious, light and pristine. The signs are largely clear to follow, although check-in desks aren't shown on screens in the check-in hall. Again, just use your eyes and look for the corporate livery above the desks. Check-in was smooth and quick, as is security. A relaxed and hassle-free experience.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: Nick Detbour
reviewBody: My wife and I arrived from Europe in JFK at 11pm (a Saturday in August 2015). We left France 13 hours earlier. For us, with the jet lag, it was 5 am. Everything was fine till we arrived at the "passport check point". We queued for more than 2 hours (while the notice board indicated 15 minutes). It was not even a quiet 2 hours. You have to listen to staff members shouting and "giving orders" to travellers, to tell them to which counter to go in order to get their passport "stamped". It was as if we were illegal travellers. You have to know that, in order to get an authorization to enter the USA, we have to fill in an application where we give information about ourselves and to pay for that. The USA does not look very welcoming from there. Security is crucial but respect of the people is also something to keep in mind, isn't it? The return flight was also an interesting experience. We had a problem with our tickets. We had to deal with airline employees who were lazy and rude. When we landed in London, it was as if we came back to civilization, with polite, helpful and efficient staff members.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: Tony Webb
reviewBody: It was only when I experienced the beautiful execution of Heathrow airport where they only announce last calls so that noise is kept down, where the security process is done efficiently with helpful staff without being shouted at by American TSA personnel as if they are in the army and we the people are there to be abused. But the most horrific experience is coming back into JFK (Terminal 7). They typically have 2 people on booth duty for citizens and about the same for non Citizens. This may be their first experience of the United States after a 8+ hour flight to be subjected to a dismal, disgraceful and for American citizens is an embarrassing experience. It took me 40 minutes to be processed but for some non citizens it must have been more than a couple of hours. I was on a British Airways flight coming into JFK on August 23rd 2015 arriving just before 9pm. What a disgrace.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: Lois Jones
reviewBody: Great airport, staff were friendly but firm. Felt very safe, everything was done very efficiently. The food and drink was good, the tables were clean and enough places to sit. I would recommend this airport.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: Derek Leask
reviewBody: Took my two teenage daughters for a special treat. Haven't seen immigration as poor as this since Sheremetyevo in Moscow back in the 80's and even that was better. Have to say it can't be a good advert for USA and New York in particular. It's not that it's slow because of the process. Once you eventually get in front of an immigration officer it's quick and painless. It's just slow because it's a shambles of disorganisation. It's a shame because New York itself was brilliant - just a terrible first impression. Will look for another access option for New York next time.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: Josephine Chang
reviewBody: I flew via JFK Airport frequently. Last year, my in built TSA lock on the luggage was spoilt during inspection. I only realised upon reaching my hotel. End up I had to buy a TSA padlock for my future trips to the USA. This time, my entire padlock was missing upon arrival outside USA. As much as we visitors respect the need of security check, JFK Airport should respect passengers' belongings as well. Utterly dissapointed and upset at how passenger  items were treated.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: Max Gross
reviewBody: Terminal 5 : I stopped here on my way from Boston to Nassau at T5. A lot of food selections, stores, and a nice state of the art new terminal. I look forward to flying through T5 again in the future.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: M Vince
reviewBody: Arriving from Paris with XL Airways after 8 hours flight and 45 minutes of waiting time on the plane to get off, we had to queue on the 1st time ESTA and overseas visitors lane. The queue was stretched with 18 zigzag lanes. The screen indicating one hour of waiting time was unreliable, showing different times ranging from 18 minutes to 1 hour. Going from one end to the other end of one lane was taking 20 minutes-ish. There were over a thousand people in the loop while at the other side US citizens, returning ESTA and American residents were given priority. 4 counters for a thousand people and the double number of counters for a few people from US. Once all US citizens and residents were gone, more counters opened and all counters were dedicated to our lane. It was fast indeed to get to the officer. 3hrs of wait in the lane, we went through the passport checking at 1.45am. Luggage belt on screen of our flight was unavailable of course after 3hrs, we had to look for our luggage at each luggage belt. Officers were nice and trying to do their best. It is on the airport management account of this nightmare. Hell in JFK. Never arrive at JFK, and avoid any Connecting flight through it, you will encounter stress to get your flight if not to miss it. Will use another airport.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: A Junge
reviewBody: My son was traveling internationally with a group of kids and leaders. He arrived at JFK for his transfer flight back to Minneapolis. The experience going thru customs was horrible. The lines were extremely long, it took forever to get their bags. My underage son (15) was separated from the group with two other underage teens. All three had to get thru customs as fast as possible to make their connecting flights. Leaders were not allowed because they didn't have connecting flights. My son tried to explain the situation "underage minors, connecting flights, needed to get thru security quickly, traveling alone, etc". The security officer says "There's no way you'll make your flight" and turned and walked away! They finally got thru customs and my son was stopped and searched. Again, security didn't listen to what he had to say, just brushed him off and walked away. All of their flights were delayed by 35-40 minutes. If security would have taken the time to help these young, underage minors, they would have all made their flights. My son got to his gate and he could see the plane at the gate. Nobody would do anything to help him. The airline told me I should have purchased the unattended minor program for over $400 both ways, but they told me that the unattended minor program only starts when the child gets to the gate. He didn't need assistance to get on the plane at the gate, he needed help getting to the gate.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: Dee Gur
reviewBody: My sister arrived from the UK, we were expecting her to come out from the security check about a hour after her arrival but it took more than two hours. The waiting time is outrageous, she claimed that only few counters were opened for the security checks while there were 200+ people waiting to get checked.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: Gaspard Smith-Vaniz
reviewBody: I last flew to New-York to see my family who lives there. I was incoming from Barcelona wth Delta Airlines. After a long flight, we arrived at the ID checking. There was almost no waiting line so we got through easily, and the police was fast. Then, I got to the luggage carousel, my suitcase was there fast. When I got out of the airport, a friend was there to pick me up.

header: New York JFK Airport customer review
author: J Thomson
reviewBody: Saddened to say but extremely rude and discourteous ground staff at port of entry. Some, not all, of those who were managing lines, baggage reclaim, and line out to ground transportation were dismissive and unhelpful to passengers who struggled with the english language - abrupt and non-friendly to put it mildly, let alone to those exhausted visitors who did speak the native tongue. Lines hours long after transatlantic flights are unacceptable, especially for families with children, and the elderly. Upside is Kiosk staff always very friendly, helpful and inviting - I enter JFK up to 8 times a year and never had a problem with the Kiosk staff. As to my repeatedly poor experience of ground staff - I know this is not representative of the best city in the world! Come on JFK, lots of improvement to be made here!
